data.text: An industrial country produces goods using its own power and natural resources.
To develop industrially, any country requires power, water supply, raw materials, machines, and workers.
Hydroelectricity is generated from water stored in dams across rivers.
The power generated by burning coal, gas or oil is called thermal power.
Power can also be generated by constructing nuclear or atomic power plants.
Solar power is generated by using the energy of the Sun.
Wind power is generated from wind by setting up windmills.
Power generated from cow dung is called biogas.
Power is also generated by extracting ethanol from sugar cane and maize.
A steady supply of water is necessary for industries as water is used in many parts of the production process.
Any matter in its natural state which is not man-made is a raw material.
Oil, coal, and natural gas are called fossil fuels.
Iron and steel, engineering, fertilizers, chemicals, cement, and textiles are some of the major industries in Pakistan.
Small industries that produce goods such as furniture, handicrafts, embroidery, and carpets are called cottage industries.
